akn:section.akn:heading: Protection of the privacy of child victims and child witnesses

akn:content.akn:p: § 403. Protection of the privacy of child victims and child witnesses A knowing or intentional violation of the privacy protection accorded by section 3509 of this title is a criminal contempt punishable by not more than one year’s imprisonment, or a fine under this title, or both. (Added Pub. L. 101–647, title II, § 225(b)(1), Nov. 29, 1990, 104 Stat. 4805.)
